comment:
Nose: crisp, light, peppery, salty with hint of vanilla
Body: medium
Palate: more full than the blended oak, sweet (bourbon notes), honey and rose petal
Finish: medium
Note: I like this more than the blended oak has more body but still light. Also reminds me of sake, maybe rice. I think is a corn distillate but this must have rice in it with a sake undertone.
Smooth. Caramel. Nice color. Simple taste

Nose: light, maybe a hint of vanilla or pear 
Body: medium
Palate: sweet, honey, floral
Finish: medium
Great balance, bourbon call gives it some nice punch
Caramel sweetness upfront with a solid punch of lasting cherry nice on the rocks

Smell: vanilla, caramel
Taste: uniquely complex, orange, sweet
Mildly spicy finish

It's an interesting whisky. I can definitely get the typical bourbon smells from it along with a citrusy smell and taste. The finish has a bit of an orange peel. It's not absolutely amazing but, I would still recommend this to someone who enjoys both bourbons as well as Japanese whiskies.
Fruity notes then a bit grainy/woody.
